Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libipa_hbac
exit 0

commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk python-libsss_nss_idmap
exit 0

islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk sssd-libwbclient-devel
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: sssd bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated sssd packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) provides a set of daemons to manage access to remote directories and authentication mechanisms. It provides the Name Service Switch (NSS) and the Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM) interfaces toward the system and a pluggable back-end system to connect to multiple different account sources.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* Due to an update in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.3, in a case-insensitive domain, the sudoUser attribute only matched the lowercase version of the LDAP user or group name. As a consequence, configurations using case-insensitive sudoUser attribute values failed. This update re-enables SSSD to match the sudoUser attribute regardless of case and now both lowercase and case-sensitive can be configured. (BZ#1392946)
* Previously, the System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) only used the domain name set in the /etc/sssd/sssd.conf file to match found entries if multiple entries matched the search result. Consequently, if two users with the same sAMAccountName attribute were present in two nested Active Directory (AD) domains and the domain name set in the /etc/sssd/sssd.conf file was different than the AD domain name, SSSD failed to resolve supplementary groups for these accounts. SSSD now uses the domain name set in the configuration file and additionally the remote domain name. As a result, secondary groups are now resolved correctly. (BZ#1393730)
* Previously, if the "ipa" or "ad" subdomain provider was set in the /etc/sssd/sssd.conf file, the System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) accessed only data that the respective authentication provider sets up. As a consequence, if the user configured the "ipa" or "ad" subdomain provider with a different authentication provider, SSSD accessed uninitialized memory and terminated unexpectedly. A patch has been applied and SSSD now only accesses data if the same authentication and subdomain provider are configured. As a result, SSSD no longer fails in the described scenario. (BZ#1396485)
* Previously, the Security Services Daemon (SSSD) did not store group names and group member names correctly if the ldap_nesting_level parameter was set to 0 in the /etc/sssd/sssd.conf file. As a consequence, resolving group members or group names failed. A patch has been applied to fix the problem and as a result, SSSD now works correctly in setups have the LDAP nesting level set to 0. (BZ#1396486)
* The System Security Services Daemon's (SSSD) cache in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.3 uses a different format to store user and group names than previous versions. SSSD automatically migrates the cache when the service is started after updating to Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.3. However, on clients with a large cache, the migration can take a long time and as a consequence, the SSSD process watchdog terminated the process and the service failed to start. This update disables the watchdog for the "sssd" process and as a result, large caches are now successfully migrated and SSSD starts correctly. (BZ#1398169)
* Previously, if the System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) failed to contact the autofs LDAP data provider, the autofs responder did not return data that was already cached locally. To fix the problem, the autofs responder has been updated and as a result, SSSD now returns cached autofs data if the LDAP server is not available. (BZ#1398673)
* Previously, if the socket that the System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) uses to communicate with the DNS server was writable and readable, and additionally an error occurred while processing the first event, SSSD accessed freed memory and the service terminated unexpectedly. A patch has been applied and SSSD now processes both events using the same resolver callback call. As a result, SSSD no longer fails in the described scenario. (BZ#1404340)
Users of sssd are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
